Chapter.Section: General aims of &Wedderga; package The title ``&Wedderga;'' stands for ``Wedderburn decomposition of a group algebras. This is a &GAP; package to compute the simple components of the Wedderburn decomposition of group algebras of finite groups over fields of characteristic zero and over finite fields. It also contains functions that produce the primitive central idempotents of these group algebras.

Main functions of &Wedderga; package
The main functions of &Wedderga; are and .
computes a list of simple algebras such that its direct product is a direct factor of the group algebra FG given as input, where G should be a finite group, and F has to be either the field Q of rationals or a finite field of characterisitc coprime with the order of G.
If the group G satisfies some mild conditions the the direct product of the output is the full group ring FG so that, in that case, the output is the Wedderburn decomposition of FG. For example this is the case if G is abelian by supersolvable. (see Chapter ) for theoretical background.
The entries of the output are given as matrix algebras over some crossed products over some cyclotomic extensions of the field F. These crossed products are in fact cyclotomic algebras and thus the entries of the output of are realizations of the Wedderburn components of QG as algebras similar to cyclotomic algebras. Recall that the Brauer-Witt Theorem ensures that every simple factor of a semisimple group ring FG is similar (that is represents the same class in the Brauer group of its centre) to a cyclotomic algebra .
The simple factors of FG are also matrix algebras over division rings which are finite extensions of the coefficient ring F. If F is finite then these division rings are finite fields, by Wedderburn Theorem. In that case the the output of represents the factors of FG as matrix algebras over finite extensions of F.
gap> QG:=GroupRing(Rationals,SymmetricGroup(4));; <algebra-with-one over Rationals, with 2 generators> gap> WedderburnDecomposition(QG); [ Rationals, Rationals, ( Rationals^[ 3, 3 ] ), ( Rationals^[ 3, 3 ] ), <crossed product over CF(3), with 2 generators> ] gap> FG:=GroupRing(GF(5),SymmetricGroup(4)); <algebra-with-one over GF(5), with 2 generators> gap> WedderburnDecomposition(FG); [ GF(5), GF(5), ( GF(5)^[ 3, 3 ] ), ( GF(5)^[ 3, 3 ] ), ( GF(5)^[ 2, 2 ] ) ]
Instead of , that returns a list of GAP objects, returns the numerical description of these objects. See Chapter for theoretical background.

Installation and system requirements
&Wedderga; does not use external binaries and, therefore, works without restrictions on the type of the operation system. It is designed for &GAP;4.4 and no compatibility with previous releases of &GAP;4 is guaranteed.
To use the &Wedderga; online help it is necessary to install the &GAP;4 package &GAPDoc; by Frank L\"ubeck and Max Neunh\"offer, which is available from the &GAP; site or from http://www.math.rwth-aachen.de/~Frank.Luebeck/GAPDoc/.
&Wedderga; is distributed in standard formats (zoo, tar.gz, tar.bz2, -win.zip) and can be obtained from http://ukrgap.exponenta.ru/wedderga.htm. To unpack the archive wedderga-4.0.zoo you need the program unzoo, which can be obtained from the &GAP; homepage http://www.gap-system.org/ (see section `Distribution'). To install &Wedderga;, copy this archive into the pkg subdirectory of your &GAP;4.4 installation. The subdirectory wedderga will be created in the pkg directory after the following command:
unzoo -x wedderga-4.0.zoo
